title: Federal Set-Aside Type Codes
description: Complete reference for Type Set Aside codes used in USASpending API filtering. These codes represent different procurement set-aside programs for small businesses and other designated contractors.
api_resources: See ../API_RESOURCES.md for complete USASpending API reference links and documentation

NONE.name: No Set Aside Used
NONE.description: Contracts awarded without any set-aside restriction
NONE.example_usage: Open competition with no special considerations

SBA.name: Small Business Set Aside - Total
SBA.description: Total small business set-aside - contract exclusively for small businesses
SBA.example_usage: All competition reserved for certified small businesses

8A.name: 8(a) Competed
8A.description: Competition restricted to 8(a) Business Development Program participants
8A.example_usage: 8(a) certified businesses compete for the contract

SBP.name: Small Business Set Aside - Partial
SBP.description: Partial small business set-aside - only portion of contract is set aside
SBP.example_usage: Multiple line items, some reserved for small business

HMT.name: HBCU or MI Set-Aside - Total
HMT.description: Historically Black Colleges & Universities or Minority Institutions - total set-aside
HMT.example_usage: Award exclusively to institutions serving underrepresented groups

HMP.name: HBCU or MI Set-Aside - Partial
HMP.description: HBCU or Minority Institution - partial set-aside
HMP.example_usage: Portion of contract set aside for HBCU/MI

VSB.name: Very Small Business
VSB.description: Set-aside for very small businesses (smaller than standard small business size standards)
VSB.example_usage: Reserved for businesses below specific employee or revenue thresholds

ESB.name: Emerging Small Business Set-Aside
ESB.example_usage: Newly formed or less established small businesses

HZC.name: HUBZone Set-Aside
HZC.description: Historically Underutilized Business Zone Program - competitive set-aside
HZC.example_usage: Businesses located in economically distressed areas can compete

SDVOSBC.name: Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business Set-Aside
SDVOSBC.description: Set-aside for Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) - competitive
SDVOSBC.example_usage: SDVOSB firms compete for the award

BI.name: Buy Indian
BI.description: Set-aside under Indian Reorganization Act for Native American owned businesses
BI.example_usage: Native American enterprises and Indian tribes

IEE.name: Indian Economic Enterprise
IEE.example_usage: Businesses owned by Indian tribes or tribal members

ISBEE.name: Indian Small Business Economic Enterprise
ISBEE.description: Small business set-aside for Indian-owned enterprises

HZS.name: HUBZone Sole Source
HZS.description: Sole source award to HUBZone business (no competition)
HZS.example_usage: Single HUBZone firm selected without competition

SDVOSBS.name: SDVOSB Sole Source
SDVOSBS.description: Sole source award to Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business
SDVOSBS.example_usage: Single SDVOSB firm awarded without competition

8AN.name: 8(a) Sole Source
8AN.description: Sole source award to 8(a) Business Development Program participant

RSB.name: Reserved for Small Business
RSB.description: Contract reserved for small business (general reserve)
RSB.example_usage: Competition limited to all certified small businesses

8AC.name: SDB Set-Aside 8(a)
8AC.description: Small Disadvantaged Business 8(a) Set-Aside (Deprecated - will be removed in future)
8AC.example_usage: Legacy code - use 8A for current awards

HS2.name: Combination HUBZone and 8(a)
HS2.description: Combined HUBZone and 8(a) set-aside (Deprecated - will be removed in future)
HS2.example_usage: Legacy code - use individual codes for current awards

HS3.name: 8(a) with HUBZone Preference
HS3.description: 8(a) award with HUBZone price evaluation preference
HS3.example_usage: 8(a) business in HUBZone receives price preference

VSA.name: Veteran Set Aside
VSA.description: Set-aside for Veteran-Owned Small Businesses (not necessarily service-disabled)
VSA.example_usage: Any veteran-owned small business can compete
VSA.note: Different from SDVOSB which is specifically service-disabled

VSS.name: Veteran Sole Source
VSS.description: Sole source award to Veteran-Owned Small Business
VSS.example_usage: Single veteran-owned firm selected without competition

WOSB.name: Women Owned Small Business
WOSB.example_usage: WOSB-certified businesses compete for the contract

EDWOSB.name: Economically Disadvantaged Women Owned Small Business
EDWOSB.description: Economically Disadvantaged Women-Owned Small Business (EDWOSB) - competitive set-aside
EDWOSB.example_usage: EDWOSB-certified businesses compete for the contract

WOSBSS.name: Women Owned Small Business Sole Source
WOSBSS.description: Sole source award to Women-Owned Small Business
WOSBSS.example_usage: Single WOSB firm selected without competition

EDWOSBSS.name: Economically Disadvantaged Women Owned Small Business Sole Source
EDWOSBSS.description: Sole source award to Economically Disadvantaged WOSB
EDWOSBSS.example_usage: Single EDWOSB firm selected without competition

small_business.name: Small Business Set-Asides
small_business.description: Set-asides for small businesses without other restrictions

socioeconomic.name: Socioeconomic Programs
socioeconomic.description: Set-asides targeting economically disadvantaged or development programs

women.name: Women-Owned Set-Asides
women.description: Set-asides for women-owned and economically disadvantaged women-owned businesses

minority.name: Minority Institution Set-Asides
minority.description: Set-asides for HBCU and minority-serving institutions

indigenous.name: Indigenous/Native American Set-Asides
indigenous.description: Set-asides for Native American and Indian-owned enterprises

all_small_business.description: Find all contracts with small business set-asides

service_disabled_veteran.description: Find all SDVOSB contracts (competed and sole source)

usage_notes.gsa_contracts: GSA frequently uses SDVOSBC and SDVOSBS codes for veteran-owned set-asides
usage_notes.dod_contracts: DoD commonly awards under 8A, SBA, and SDVOSB set-asides
usage_notes.sole_source_vs_competed: Sole source codes (S suffix) indicate single award without competition, while competed codes allow multiple bids
usage_notes.deprecated_codes: 8AC and HS2 are deprecated and should not appear in new contracts
usage_notes.multiple_criteria: Some businesses may qualify for multiple set-asides but contract uses most restrictive
